alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:59PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LAUREL...WEST CENTRAL OWSLEY...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTHWESTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 258 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mcwhorter, or 9 miles northeast of London, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Datha, Shepherdtown, Malcomb, Sextons Creek and Thomas. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
